Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: dprint
Description: A pluggable and configurable code formatting platform written in Rust

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Path or url to JSON configuration file. Defaults to dprint.json or .dprint.json in current or ancestor directory when not provided

Arguments.Name: config
Arguments.Description: config

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Prints help information

Arguments.Name: --plugins
Arguments.Description: List of urls or file paths of plugins to use. This overrides what is specified in the config file

Arguments.Name: urls/files
Arguments.Description: urls/files

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Prints additional diagnostic information

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initializes a configuration file in the current directory

Arguments.Name: fmt
Arguments.Description: Formats the source files and writes the result to the file system

Arguments.Name: --diff
Arguments.Description: Outputs a check-like diff of every formatted file

Arguments.Name: --stdin
Arguments.Description: Format stdin and output the result to stdout. Provide an absolute file path to apply the inclusion and exclusion rules or an extension or file name to always format the text

Arguments.Name: extension/file-name/file-path
Arguments.Description: extension/file-name/file-path

Arguments.Name: --incremental
Arguments.Description: Only format files when they change. This may alternatively be specified in the configuration file

Arguments.Name: incremental
Arguments.Description: incremental

Arguments.Name: true
Arguments.Description: incremental

Arguments.Name: false
Arguments.Description: incremental

Arguments.Name: --excludes
Arguments.Description: List of file patterns or directories in quotes to exclude when formatting. This overrides what is specified in the config file

Arguments.Name: pattern
Arguments.Description: pattern

Arguments.Name: --allow-node-modules
Arguments.Description: Allows traversing node module directories (unstable - This flag will be renamed to be non-node specific in the future)

Arguments.Name: files
Arguments.Description: files
